Package de.fraunhofer.iem.secucheck.InternalFluentTQL.catalog.SQLInjection.CWE89

Class SimpleSQLInjectionTest

  • java.lang.Object
    • de.fraunhofer.iem.secucheck.InternalFluentTQL.catalog.SQLInjection.CWE89.SimpleSQLInjectionTest
  • public class SimpleSQLInjectionTest
extends java.lang.Object

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor Description
      SimpleSQLInjectionTest()  

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void attackerAccessingTheDataWithoutSanitizer()
      This test case tests for the scenario where attacker is trying SQL Injection on an application that does not uses sanitizer, therefore SQL Injection happens.
      void attackerAccessingTheDataWithSanitizer()
      This test case tests for the scenario where attacker trying SQL injection on application that uses sanitizer.
      void clear()
      This method clears the database after the test case ran.
      void normalUserAccessingTheDataWithoutSanitizer()
      This test case tests for the scenario where normal user access the data from database that does not uses sanitizer and behaves normally.
      void normalUserAccessingTheDataWithSanitizer()
      This test case tests for the scenario where normal user accessing the database on application that uses sanitizer.
      void setUp()
      This method set up the database server required for testing.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Method Detail

      • setUp

        public void setUp()
           throws java.sql.SQLException,
                  java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        This method set up the database server required for testing.
        Throws:
        java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - If the JDBCDriver class is not found.
        java.sql.SQLException - If the processing of SQL fails.

      • clear

        public void clear()
           throws java.sql.SQLException
        This method clears the database after the test case ran.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the processing of SQL fails.

      • attackerAccessingTheDataWithoutSanitizer

        public void attackerAccessingTheDataWithoutSanitizer()
                                              throws java.sql.SQLException
        This test case tests for the scenario where attacker is trying SQL Injection on an application that does not uses sanitizer, therefore SQL Injection happens.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the processing of SQL fails.

      • normalUserAccessingTheDataWithoutSanitizer

        public void normalUserAccessingTheDataWithoutSanitizer()
                                                throws java.sql.SQLException
        This test case tests for the scenario where normal user access the data from database that does not uses sanitizer and behaves normally.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the processing of SQL fails.

      • attackerAccessingTheDataWithSanitizer

        public void attackerAccessingTheDataWithSanitizer()
        This test case tests for the scenario where attacker trying SQL injection on application that uses sanitizer. In this case, it throws a SQLSyntaxErrorException and avoids SQL Injection.

      • normalUserAccessingTheDataWithSanitizer

        public void normalUserAccessingTheDataWithSanitizer()
                                             throws java.sql.SQLException
        This test case tests for the scenario where normal user accessing the database on application that uses sanitizer. In this case, it behaves normally
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException - If the processing of SQL fails.
